The filling is typically piped or spooned into the egg whites, which are then garnished with chopped green onions. The filling is creamy and seasoned, with a vibrant red hue from the paprika and green flecks from the chives, creating a visually appealing contrast against the white egg whites.	<>	Deviled eggs are prepared by stuffing hard-boiled eggs with a creamy mixture of mayonnaise, egg yolks, mustard, and often seasoned with diced bacon, chopped chives, and paprika, creating a vibrant, textured, and garnished presentation.	<>	Deviled eggs are made by halving hard-boiled eggs, removing the yolks, and then combining them with mayonnaise and seasonings like paprika, salt, and pepper. The yolks are mashed and piped back into the egg whites, then garnished with ingredients such as chopped green onions and diced bacon. The eggs are typically served cold on a wooden board, showcasing a creamy yellow filling against the white egg whites.
